meanings.definition: A small evergreen tree native to South America.
meanings.sent1: The maqui in the forest had shiny leaves.
meanings.sent2: I learned about the maqui tree in school.
meanings.sent3: The maqui tree whispered secrets to the other plants.
meanings.sent4: The maqui stood tall like a guardian of the jungle.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant green of the maqui tree was a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: A dark purple edible berry produced by the maqui tree.
meanings.sent1: The maqui was sweet and juicy when I tasted it.
meanings.sent2: The maqui berries made a delicious jam.
meanings.sent3: The maqui berry rolled away, trying to escape being eaten.
meanings.sent4: Her lips turned purple after eating the maqui berry.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the ripe maqui filled the kitchen with delight.

meanings.definition: A type of Chilean wine made from maqui berries.
meanings.sent1: I enjoyed a glass of maqui with dinner last night.
meanings.sent2: The maqui wine had a rich flavor.
meanings.sent3: The maqui wine danced in the glass, tempting me to drink it.
meanings.sent4: Her cheeks flushed after sipping the maqui wine.
meanings.sent5: The deep hue of the maqui wine hinted at its bold taste.
